intro: Volutaria lippii var. eutubuliflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, which bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Volutaria lippii var. eutubuliflora is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
